(The chief priestichi exchanged greetings.
He turned around and went to the messenger's desk.
He exchanged greetings with one.
He returned to the inner altar.)
(The presiding buddha proffers incense.
He makes a proclamation and rings a bell.
The presiding Dharma offered three prostrations.)
(The announcement was made.) After the dispatch of the envoy, the banner was raised on land and water.
He spreads his banner over water and land.
His grace extends throughout the sandy region.
The congregation of sages in the south (exchanged greetings.
They left the altar).

source_sentence: 法界聖凡水陸大齋普利道場性相通論卷第二
translation: The Dharma Realm of Saints and Worldlings, the Water-Land Dazhai, and the Nature of the Place of Practice, the Shared Treatise, Volume 2
